ltcl: Rewrite: PHP8.4, Neoforge, improvements and bug fixes
changelog:
v2.0.0

  • Upgrade to PHP 8.4
  • Neoforge support and improved fabric support
  • Distinction between different mod loaders.
  • New database implementation - Added SQLite support!
  • Proper version compatility checks
  • Improved TOML parser (edge cases and general use)
  • Reduced disk I/O when adding/downloading mods
  • Reduced risk of file locking (cache.json •-•)
  • Fixed admin/user permission issues
  • Resolved SQL race conditions everywhere
  • New built-in updater - requires use of the docker image, or cloning the repository and a git executable.
  • Huge amount of code refactoring
  • Other bug fixes & improvements

    • Upgrade instructions
    1. Install new Technic Solder version. Either `git pull` over SSH, or re-upload the TechnicSolder folder and files; Make sure to preserve your mods, others, forges folders, as well as file functions/config.php
    2. Upgrade/switch to PHP8.3 and install and enable the PHP8.4-PDO, PHP8.4_PDO-MYSQL or/and PHP8.4-PDO_SQLITE, and PHP8.4-ZIP extensions.
    3. You will then need to run /functions/upgrade2.0.php to modify your existing database.
